column11: Review Text
Central shopping centre over several floors, with each floor focused on different types of shops, such as womenswear primarily on one floor, luxury on another.

column8: Good shopping complex to visit whilst in Colombo
column11: Great shopping centre complex with lots of variety. Had a great coffee and light snack. Definitely worth the visit. Recommend for a visit
It's a good place for dining, shopping and hanging out solo or with friends and family. Have a bunch of high end brand outlets, restaurants and gaming areas.

column8: The largest shopping mall in the country.
column11: We spent a couple of hours here before we left Unavatuna. This 7-storey shopping mall is part of a commercial and residential complex managed by Shangri-La. Of course, we've been to big shopping complexes in Manila, Dubai, New York and so on, but in Sri Lanka, this mall opened in 2019 is the biggest. We were seven stories long. The names of most brands were unfamiliar to us. It's amazing. It's usually the same thing everywhere. Finished the acquaintance at the center in the Italian cafe Negozio della Pasta. Very nice, by the way...
We had a great stay at Jetwing Jaffna. All Reception Staff were very friendly and efficient. Priya was particularly welcoming and helpful with our queries about the hotel services.

Called in today for a walk around and found the good court on the bottom of the centre. This provides a great service and different food for all my party to select something different. Fabulous to visit

column8: Beautiful Mall in Colombo next to the Shangri-La Hotel and right on the beach
column11: Nice mall with nice shops, good food court and supermarket in the basement. We stayed at the attached Shangri-La Hotel. Eating at the mall we were once on the roof terrace for sundowners and once at the Pasta Restaurant on the 5th or 6th. Floor. Top!
We got hot walking around Pettah market so headed here for air con. A nice enough shopping centre and easy to get an uber back to hotel from here.
Luxury mall situated right next to the Shangri La Hotel. Has everything you need and more and we were greatful to be able to shop a little while we were there.
Very Nice mall.Thr food court was nice.Nice shops.Nice cinema.I always go to this mall with my friends and family.Good place for tourists

One Galle Face was our tour leader recommendation for shopping , actually there are a few limited brands with limited items , only Gem shops were interesting , downstairs was food court that we had meal , also next to entrance gate there is a restaurant . no special item and not recommend to visit unless you have time that you wonder how spend .
An excellent shopping center to escape the heat. It's giant with lots of clothing stores, bars and restaurants. Highly recommended

This is the largest shopping mall in Sri Lanka, offering all the amenities you could need. It features a wide variety of shops, catering to both high-end and budget shoppers, as well as numerous restaurants, a food court, and smaller specialty shops. There is also a movie theater, a kids‚Äô play area, and many other attractions. On weekends, you‚Äôll often find pop-up shops adding to the vibrant atmosphere. This shopping mall is a popular hangout spot for youngsters and their friends. If you‚Äôre looking to buy branded items, this is the place to go. However, weekends can be a bit crowded. The mall has a large parking area, and while parking isn‚Äôt free, the fee is quite reasonable.

There is a security check when you enter, so you can play with peace of mind. There was a supermarket in the basement, and I bought souvenirs there. There was also a lot of tea. There were also two Spa Ceylon stores, one for home and one for cosmetics. The location is good, so I went there twice during my trip.
Quite crowded and noisy. The hot mocha was good.  Not very impressed with the sandwich.  The seatings were limited so had to wait a while.
7 floors huge Lots of shops very high price with a salary 300 euros (smic) I don't know how they live
Very large shopping mall Open from 10:00 a.m. If behind the clothes, you have to work to find something suitable for yourself. KFstam is expensive, you can eat elsewhere.
One of the greatest shopping mall we visited during our stay in Sri Lanka. Have many options for clothing and prices. Not too crowded.
Modern shopping mall, unique shops designed to attract foreign guest. My favourite place was the food court in the ground floor

Our experience at Tea Lounge was amazing. All the workers were really friendly and especially Inoka and Chaminda. Inoka, Despite being the sous chef with overwhelming work she still took the time to come and speak to us and made us feel at home. She is an extremely pleasant and kind hearted individual and we really enjoyed speaking to her. She made our day and spoke to us with so much kindness. I could remember when my kids were small how amazing her cakes were and we would always order cakes from her at Cinnamon grand. Chaminda is also an absolute amazing individual and very pleasant. My kids really look forward to speaking to Chaminda and Inoka.We really had a wonderful experience and definitely hope to seeing both of them again.

Our visit was quite enjoyable and obviously quite expensive. Our grans kid 2 years spent 2 hours in the kids area too. We had tea and eats in the basement too. Everything was OK until we got to the parking - ALAS you are discouraging customers OR you don't want visitors, I am sure I will let my friends KNOW about your parking policies. You charge for every minute of parking - irrespective of what ever shopping or Function you attend. PATHATIC is not enough of a word.

Initially we did not want to go to a shopping mall but our guide taking us around Colombo insisted we should go for a coffee or snack. (Really he had to pick something up for himself?) We went along and bought a chai tea and a samosa from a little tuc tuc street food vendor while we waited for our guide and it was the best chai tea and samosa! So our guide was redeemed! We did not look over the shops, just had our amazing snack and left.

One in the best Shopping Malls in Srilanka. they have 9 film halls and food stalls in Basement and iconic food stalls on some floors. even kid , teen , old person have things to there.  they have an app to collect points also. if you spend more you can earn more. super clean. and washrooms are clean, this one is must visit place for shopping. its very close to PortCity and GalleFace beach, and it has direct access from Shangri La hotel also.

A lot of shops hardly have any stock in their shops. This is quite remarkable as the explanation given is because of lack of imports. But when checking Havelock City Mall, the same shops have a lot more stocks available‚Ä¶
We visited this shopping mall recently when it was raining outside as we had read it was a good place to visit. We were very underwhelmed with the shops and the centre. We won‚Äôt be returning.

One Galle Face is rather an enigma. It has several shops with very expensive foreign merchandise, including Sri Lanka's own Odel, which are largely devoid of customers, while at the top of the mall and one floor under underground, the restaurants coffee and food bars were full of people. There were not many people on the five floors in between.
So many international local brand stores withavailable in One Galle Face including Keels' supermarket also available with the food court level.

We visited One Galle Face mall yesterday, and it was great. This is a much larger shopping mall and has a fully fledged food court on top floor and hosts many international brand chain stores within it. It's very spacious with a very clean design. We visited on a Monday, so it was fairly quiet, so we didn't feel rushed. Highly recommended for a slow shopping stroll.

One gall face is a nice shopping mall in Colombo. It is internally connected to some of the surrouunding hotels such as Taj Samudra and ShangriLa. One can find both global and local brands here. If you are a foreigner and want to shop some Sri Lankan items, this is a very good place.

A nice mall near Taj Samudra where we stayed. They have some nice shops. The food court was excellent. We had pakisthani and Thai food which were good especially the Thai food. We shopped at Odel which was great.

One Galle Face Mall, also known as One Galle Face, is a huge shopping mall complex located right across the Galle Face Green in Colombo, Sri Lanka. One golf face mall is the place where we were told to go to have fun. Its has somany entertainment actives .we don't forget to go there as soon as we get a chance. Why? It's a popular destination for shopping, dining, and entertainment, and is considered the biggest and most luxurious mall in Sri Lanka. From high-end designer stores to popular fashion brands and sportswear outlets, One Galle Face Mall has it all. You'll also find stores selling electronics, homeware, beauty products, and much more. The mall has a great selection of restaurants and cafes, offering everything from casual Sri Lankan cuisine to international fare. There's also a food court with a variety of quick and easy options. One Galle Face Mall has a modern cinema complex, a children's play area, and an arcade. It's a great place to spend a day or evening with family or friends. The mall has ample parking space, free Wi-Fi, and a variety of other amenities to make your visit enjoyable.

There were 03.23.24 who are going to come here for world brands DO NOT DO THIS, there are shops, but there are no things there. For example, Calvin Klein has a selection of 10 men's T-shirts, which are only available in one size S or M. The same story with Armani, Guess, and others. The prices are the same as in Russia, you won‚Äôt notice any benefits. I can only mention Polo, there is a choice of prices for T-shirts 6000-8000 rupees, polos 8000-12000, which is what we bought from. There was also something to see in Puma and Adidas, but it was definitely not worth coming here from Hikkaduwa for this)
Adidas, Mango, Nike, Puma, Clarks, Asics are so small. You can find foodcourt in basement. It is big and not bad‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶.,..
Great shopping centre. Don‚Äôt be put off by the high end stores as you come in. There are lovely shops upstairs so look around

great place for shopping and quite a good food court with italian cousine and fast food points. It is a pleasent place to spend several hours where you can find anything you need including even massage saloon.

Attached to the hotel we were staying at, we visited regularly and loved the diverse mix of shops on offer.  Particularly awesome was the bottom floor food hall which we adored.  Loved the clean and new aesthetic - this place is a must visit!
Decent mall with most things you might want.  Not far from Columbo Fort station so we did a shopping trip between trains. One toilet did not have toilet paper.  housekeeping take note!

Fancy shopping mall, lots of shops and restaurants. also a cinema Loved this shopping mall and do recommend it. There are also lots of taxis and tuk-tuk at the entrance, so no worries when you are done with your shopping.

Went to watch a movie at the PVR on 31st Dec. I forgot to update my OGF points from the PVR at the top floor which can be used for the parking. So when I came down to concierge I asked them to update. I showed them the Mobile ticket which the PVR sends to your mobile when you purchase the ticket online. It includes all the details - date/ location / amount, etc. But they refused to update saying it is not a valid ticket. And asked me to go all the way up and get a receipt and come back. I asked them why do you need another ticket and their response was mobile tickets are not valid. I wasn't going to waste my time again to go all the way up 6 floors and get receipts just to use for my parking. But the point is the level of quality of the staff at OGF. 1. No proper training. 2. Not aware that the Mobile tickets / E-tickets are valid similarly in this day and age as to a printed ticket. 3. Not even bothered to check with the PVR if it is valid or not. 4. Not even bothered to even check with one of their managers. 5. Not even option on their OGF site to even put a complaint. (Probably why the two receptionists at the counter said its okay when I told them that I will complaint) All in all I can think of is staff quality and training needs to be improved.

The trip to Colombo is meaningless if you miss out on this elegant beauty. Massive mall housing top brands , this place shows you the modern srilanka with a cool ambience. The beach right opposite to it is a must see too. We bought kites there and had a lot of fun. The locality is posh with many high end hotels. It‚Äôs Colombo‚Äôs showstopper.

Worse experience I ever had in Srilanka We came on 17th of December with my family and another 5 teenagers,totally 10. We pre booked the cinnama tickets to be seated at 10.15 am. Worce wellcome is at security 1. My son bought skate board with him and as per security standard was not allowed to take in. I have no issue with health and safety concerns, but there must be a place to keep this, unfortunately thre is no place to keep.( some malls not allowed to use the skateboard and they politely let us know we can keep the board with is and not to use) 2. Concierge- when I reached them, there no wellcome and no smile at all. 3. non of them wants to give me a solution to my issue instead act like another security role. finally I gave up dealing with them to see the movie. We had to wait more than 22 minutes and couldn't watched the first part of movie. Usually I don't wrote revies as I'm a senior hotelier and live in Europe. Reasons I'm writing this Non of them wants to solve the problem instead defend. and they keep telling me this is international policy . I have been travelling across the Europe never such policyie Worse part is I have worked in Shangri-La chain and never seen such policy Need to correct your attitude. Need to use your common sense rather Than sitting on your policie. This whole incident ruined my whole day and this is not Shangri-La standard this is a disgrace for Shangri-La.

One Galle Face Mall is hands down the best mall not just in Colombo, but in the entire Sri Lanka! It's a paradise for luxury brand lovers with a fantastic variety to choose from. The mall boasts a plethora of shops and an abundance of delicious food options, making it a shopper's dream and a foodie's haven. What sets it apart is the top-notch PVR Indian Theatre on the top floor ‚Äì clean, well-maintained, and staffed by a friendly team. It's a perfect spot to catch a movie while enjoying a great mall experience. Overall, it's a top-tier destination with everything you could ask for in a mall ‚Äì shopping, dining, and entertainment, all under one roof!

Wow !!!  what a superb mall in the heart of Colombo. Lots of shops in the six floors with a modern shopping mall and food court. This mall is every bit as good as what you will find in the US or Dubai

I had high hopes for the horror house event at One Galle Face Mall, but unfortunately, it turned out to be a major letdown. The event, organized by the marketing manager Malika and her team, was poorly coordinated from start to finish. The queuing system was a complete mess. Security was ineffective, allowing people to jump ahead, resulting in those who followed the rules waiting for hours without any progress. This lack of control was frustrating and took away from the overall experience. Furthermore, technical issues plagued the event, causing lengthy delays. This mismanagement left many kids and patrons, including myself, feeling disappointed and dissatisfied. I hope the organizers take this feedback seriously and work towards improving future events. As it stands, I would hesitate to attend another event organized by this team.

A great shopping center. Has everything that you can find in shopping centers all over the world. Very spacious with escalators, which is convenient. The negative point is: there is no paper in the well-kept toilets. The anal douches aren't for everyone either. So the beautifully polished paper dispensers are simply left empty. ! ALL ! It's worth noting that there is a disinfectant for cleaning the seat - but how do you use it? By hand? Too bad - you need paper. The tourists are used to it.

Galle Face is Colombo first prestigious shopping development mall in Colombo. Galle Face Hotel established in 1864 is one of the oldest hotels in Asia. Galle Face is a 12  acres ocean-sided  urban park, which stretches for 1625 feet along the coast in the heart of Colombo. It was originally laid out in 1859 by Governor Sir Henry George. The original Galle Face Green was much larger than it is today and initially used for horse racing and a golf course

Decades ago when I travelled to Sri Lanka (back in the 1980s), there were only a handful of shopping malls in Colombo but now Sri Lanka has advanced so much with modern shopping malls like One Galle Face dotted across the city. I spent an afternoon here. There were so many different shops - from clothing to Sri Lankan handicrafts. If you need retail therapy during your visit to Colombo -  well then here it is!

We got half veggie half chicken pizza... Because I'm a quite different veggie person Order is like super fast ,we enjoyed it a lot.. highly recommend this place "Always choose corner tables" One of the best place you should try if you're visiting one galleface

It was nice visiting One Galle Face Mall after a very long time. A nice shopping mall, with many food stalls with a variety of international food stalls & a Sri-Lankan food stall  in the Food Court. Also,  many other shops with a variety of items available, even window shopping is fun. Well maintained & also   very clean. Well worth a visit, if you have time to relax.

One Galle Face Mall in Colombo is a shopper's paradise and a must-visit destination. This modern and expansive mall offers a wide range of shopping options, from luxury brands to local boutiques, catering to all tastes and budgets. The mall's sleek design and well-organized layout make it easy to navigate and explore. With a variety of dining options, including cafes and restaurants, visitors can refuel and relax amidst their shopping spree. One Galle Face Mall is a vibrant and bustling hub that guarantees an enjoyable and fulfilling shopping experience in Colombo.
Friendly people, safety  and cleanliness was amazing. Food was fantastic. So many places to visit including great shopping experience. Saturday good market is a must.

Lovely big shopping centre, lots of upmarket as well as more affordable shops.  Great food court with lots of options.  Good restrooms, but beware, no toilet paper in the men‚Äôs toilets.  However, they did have in the ladies.  This is something that should be improved on if they want tourists to visit.  Also, there is no where to sit.  There are a few  rock like structures on each floor, the only place to rest, and generally used by groups of young people hanging out.  Also in the food court, lots of good outlets with nowhere to sit eg Roots, Green Cabin and loads more.  Need seats and tables for those choosing to eat from these outlets.

This was our first visit to One galle Face, the latest most upmarket shopping complex in Sri Lanka but, in comparison with shopping malls in many countries, it was average - nothing special. Would we go again? I'm not sure.

We enjoyed spending several hours shopping in One Galle Face. Five floors of air conditioned shops and a food court. What's not to like? The male toilets. None of which contain any toilet paper, but every cubicle contains an empty toilet roll dispenser? We spoke to an attendant who told us this was 'management policy', and my wife told me that paper was available in the ladies. So if you are male, western/European, then I'm afraid you'll have to do without toilet roll in this so-called 'modern shopping complex'. Stupid.

How Colombo has changed in recent years! This great new shopping mall is a welcome addition to the city. Six floors are all there to explore with so many retail outlets including some of the world's great brands as well as more local products. There are many restaurants to choose from as well as other important facilities including a private hospital. Definitely to be recommended.

Nice mall to spend the day , has a lot of things to keep you busy. The spas and cafe are good places to relax after a day of shopping. There are some nice cinemas with excellent services, worth a visit and a nice location.
The only decent shopping mall in Colombo. It has a lot of international brands, a good food court and attached to the Shangri La Hotel No good coffee shop though

This is Sri Lanka‚Äôs largest shopping mall. This building has 6 floors. 6th floor is where the bars at. Food court is on the ground floor. One Galle face shopping mall has almost everything you are looking for. Very popular place among locals and tourists. Situated right next to Shangrila Hotel.

I went to this place but I have seen so many fake tour guides were targeting guests. I had to face this experience few day ago when I was coming from the Odel and waiting for my car in the Lobby. They need to improve the service well.
One and only mall in Sri Lanka... One and only mall in sl. You can go with friends , family and you will find things to do and many places to grab a meal

The only modern mall in the city But prices are higher than my country Food court is good but there isn‚Äôt a single Starbucks or any other coffee place if you are a coffee drinker then you gonna starve here.

Awesome shopping experience. So many shops and you can select from a wide range of products. Prices are a bit higher though. There are branded item outlets, restaurants, cafes, play areas, cinema and much more.

Went for the cinema and the parking was full where we had to park at L2 parking. At the end of the movie which causes a huge rush in the park, only one exit gate was opened and people were charged for all the hours including nearly the 2 hours spent in the car park to exit. This was followed by the pathetic behavior of security officers who were very hostile and charging at the gate without any regret about this situation.

This is the most expensive shopping mall I have ever visited in my life. For a haircut, the saloon inside the mall is charging Rs. 5,000. You can expect one pair of shoes to cost around Rs. 15,000 on average. The food court is however affordable. I wouldn‚Äôt recommend this place for shopping unless you have enough to spend on things that could be afforded at a cheaper rate outside. But aside of the expensive rates, the mall is super clean and spacious. The safety measures against Covid-19 are enforced. The location of the mall is strategic as well.

One Galle Face in Colombo is one of the biggest shopping Mall that I ever visited.  It is very large, luxurious and a comfortable place to relax during the day. You will find many branded shops in the mall but the prices are very expensive. Before we entered the mall, the security guards make sure to take our temperatures and sanitize our hands. I would highly recommend not to try the hair cutting in the mall as it‚Äôs really expensive.

If you need to find some word for all-inclusive... yes One Galle Face mall is the right word for it... cool balcony on 6th floor.. clothing shops, household items, jewelries, restaurants much more things under the one roof...

It's true that pandemic created disturbance. Quiet atmosphere in the entire mall. Not activities at all for holiday season. Believe it's time to move on with daily  usual life. Shops and outlets got to come up with some form of activities to attract business.

Right next to Shangri la Colombo, this place has a variety of shops to go for and good place to find branded and some unique items also this place have good restaurants for you to dine in. . . Thanks, Priyanath Lokubaranige.

I recently visisted One GalleFace Mall. This shopping mall is very clean and has a good range of shops. On the top floor it has a good range of eating outlets and many floors of shops. On the Ground or basement level is the Food Court with a Keells supermarket.

Very disappointed security. And very rude. Since I and my friend was sitting near the British pub near the PVR cinema hall and was talking without the mask on me for the few minutes he was so rude and kept on coming and shouting at us. There were plenty of others too who wasn‚Äôt wearing the mask, but he specifically came and was asking if we cannot wear our mask to leave the premises. Really it was a bad incidence, I came there for lunch at the Indian restaurant and had some shopping at the mall and then came to relax and have a chat but this security just messed up my whole mood. Plus if it was equal to everyone I don‚Äôt mind. But that man just specifically came coz it was only two girls and no man to shout at him. Plus Most of the people who Worked there didn‚Äôt have the mask on them. But I don‚Äôt understand why he specifically came to us and was rudely talking and trying ask us to move out of the building. I‚Äôll keep my friends also informed about my bad experience about this place. I normally recommend and this was my 4th visit to one Galle Face, because it looked very professional.  And will never want to step in to one Galle face again. This is so bad experience.
adjacent to shangri la hotel so very convenient very quiet .corona?? nice mix of stores good selection in food court some lovely stores

It's a mall with many outlets such as miniso,kfc,McDonald's,burger king,frosty rolls, Wofl, Kells,Singer,Odel,Jezza,Live and kicking and more.. Keels i think it should be on ground floor rather, a floor down. Lifts are too busy, some peoples are just fresh buttons and don't get in. must have a controller in a lift to avoid playing or misusing around. good security.  must have some daily kids activity. that attract many families to come in.
A brand new mall right on the seafron. Usual brands seen across the world of high end brand shops. A great  eating area of world foods to chose from. Cannot go wrong for nice dining

One Galle mall is kinda normal shopping mall. There was luxurious stores but also cheaper shops. The mall is good if you want to find global brands in Sri Lanka. There you can also find some national brands.

This new structure opened to the public recently has a resemblance to the malls in Orchard Road or Peoples park in Singapore. Interesting is that it has lot of space compared to cramped up shopping centres. Place was full of people who seem to have visited the place for curiosity and fun as I did not see similar crowds in the many shopping outlets. However, it is a place for many internationally popular brands to be shopped under one roof and exclusive sellers of special products selling off sale carts. One such was the organic bees honey seller in the food court area. Food court appeared to be very popular with great patronage.
This is the new and big mall in Colombo. They have branded shops and restaurants here. There is a international food court also. Enough parking.
Good collection of local brands. Also some international brands. Few nice restaurants. Nice food market. We enjoyed a drink and some nice food at British Pub.

One of the biggest shopping malls in Sri Lanka.The mall is so beautiful and modern.Lot of shops are available from low range goods to high range stuff. Both branded and non branded shops are available.A massive food court and a super quality cinema complex are available in here.

A large glitzy Western style mall with a fast food court in basement as well as other restaurants in upper levels.  Many storefronts are closed but I did particularly enjoy Spa Ceylon and a good wine & beer shop tucked in the corner. Good security to enter.  Felt safe.
That is a very nice and lot of expirienced place of the shopping in Town...its a nice expirence for all of my friends
nice location adjoining Sharila hotel. A high end mall. Most international products. Food cour available

One Galle Face is a lovely Mall of international standard. Many shops with Branded products.Prices too are of International standards. The Food Court is very good with a wide choice of restaurants. However the parking fees are are too much for the Locals, & most Foreign Tourists come in Hired vehicles, therefore they do not keep the vehicle in the Car park. All in all its a nice experience.

Its long waiting mall for Colombo. Yes it real big shopping mall compare to other small size ones in Colombo. many international brands. One thing I like here is food court in Ground floor unlike other malls.. It seperating foodies from real shoppers,

This is the most required thing in Colombo's heart. Good shopping mall with lots of shops and varieties. The food court also grat. We can roam and find a great meal. PVR Cinema is also excellent. There are lots of choices. However, the parking area is pretty confusing. Routes are not clear. Parking charges also very high. They should give parking complimentary at least for Cinema users.

One Galle Face was needed in Colombo and it is one of the best malls in Sri Lanka. It has all the shops that are well known - Nike, Adidas, Tommy, Guess, Armani, etc. It is a place that you can just look around as i is a nicely set out mall. There should be a few more shops but it is definitely an improvement in Sri Lanka's shopping. The cinema is the best too, it is better than the ones in the UK and US. Really clean and a great atmosphere. They also have various food courts and restaurants which seem all great too me.

One Galle Face is a fabulous shopping mall and its good to have such place in the heart. Its a good business venture once all the other adjoining buildings starts occupying. However week end vehicle admission is a nightmare and we do understand that's for our own safety. Let people get use to convenient shopping, dinning and entertainment under one roof. Wish this project a greater success
Great mall to enjoy some halaal food options. Movies theatre is pretty cool, too. Lively atmosphere and situated on the beach.

It is a nice mall with a variety of stores and shopping options. Try the boutique stores and you are sure to get some cute items there. The food options are good and I would particularly recommend the British pub. One thing to watch out is the exorbitant parking rates. I would totally avoid the parking and take a cab there. I feel ripped off after the last visit!

One Galle Face is more of a fortified army camp like place with guards, x-ray machines, metal detectors all over the place. If you want to experience how it feels like to enter a military facility, this is the place to go. Right from the car park entry to going into shops there are number of checkpoints with radiation emitting machines, pat downs etc. Next they may introduce body cavity search too. Shops are useless and people go there just to spend time, not to buy ridiculously overpriced junk. Most of the restaurants in the food court don't even give water or at least there's no facility to buy a bottle of water. Terrible experience and that place is not for shoppers, but for time-wasters who wants to spend few hours roaming around. Don't waste your time going to this place.

Been twice, first in early December about four weeks after the official opening then yesterday, January almost eight weeks after. The initial visit found many shops yet to open, poorly signposted to find one‚Äôs way around, possibly only one interactive information on level 1(street) and one with two staff, who I found were not able to give clear directions, e.g. ago this way rather than ‚Äòturn to your right and walk to the end and take the escalator up‚Äô.  Think staff need training on dealing with the types of questions put to them. Yesterday I had limited time and shopped at Odel and Genelle, the former because I expected larger range than Ward Place, actually was less though very good discounts in Men‚Äôs wear, my focus; the latter because I heard Genelle‚Äôs design range at this mall was unique and unavailable at other outlets. Again good shopping for shoes, and as a week day, not crowded. The mall‚Äôs spacious layout very pleasant, airy and the atrium style height takes away the claustrophobic feeling of many of Colombo‚Äôs older malls. People were still snapping pics in front of Christmas decor. However, modern design seems not to extend to basics such as signposting so the shopper can be independent and confident how to find what they want, lack of ATMs and almost abysmal directions to reach the pick-up drop-off point. If you ordered a cab and it‚Äôs arriving getting out of the building even from level 1 through the many exits and security entrances very poorly signposted and a nightmare. Added to which the fittings over the exit I was heading to fell off just missing the man in front of me. That exit could no longer be used as the wiring above the doors obstructed movement. On service at the two shops I visited, staff at Genelle (only two it seemed) were good, brought shoes out and helped me fit. At Odel though, there were many staff around, seemingly disinterested in selling or directing me to what I needed. I was drawn to some items on discount. Staff attitude seemed to expect me to remember the clothing and each discount. Floor staff seemed incompetent in dealing with the complexity of different discounts on different items which the customer was expected to work out. One staffer gave me the original cost of the item when I inquired if it was on discount, had to go to the cashier and return to me to give me the final price. The simplest would have been for management to have had both pre and post discounts indicated on the price tag. Finally, at the pay counter staff were unable to give me the costs of the discounted items I‚Äôd picked, very confusing for a customer, with their different discount rates, making it hard for a customer to decide what to buy. An alternate at that point might have been to have had one staffer give me the final cost on each item, especially as there were no other shoppers paying at either of the two cashiers at the time.

Largest shopping mall in heart of Colombo. Nice atmosphere and large number of international branded shops. Clean and have variety of shops. Have a large parking area but its difficult to find as no proper guidance given for the entry point.Had a hassle to find it.Parking fees are bit high. Good place to shop but its on the much expensive side. Have a big children s play area. Large number of restaurants and variety of food is available. Overall good place to have an nice shopping experience.

I did not allow enough time to go shopping here.  Spread over many floors, this welcome addition to Colombo's economy was vast and had every conceivable outlet you could possibly want to visit.  There were themed Christmas events as well and singers etc serenading you whilst you shopped.  A huge, and I mean huge, Christmas tree spanned through the floors and was a wonderful photo opportunity.  The street parking/drop off/pick up area/ was packed, so getting to and from this mall was tricky to say the least. If you like shopping - this is the place for you.

This is a welcome addition to Colombo, a mall of this level was long overdue and is a huge improvement over the deplorable and shabby ' majestic city ' and ' liberty plaza ' that try to pass off as malls. It's an Upscale mall, their PVR multiplex is another huge improvement over the existing movie theaters in Colombo, they need to improve their food service, its unprofessionally run and the service is awful. Our hot dogs were delivered without tissues/napkins and they seemed surprised when we asked for some. The basement parking area has a smooth surface and gets very slippery in some areas due to water deposits from the aircons of idling cars and parked cars. I counted a total of 7 people who slipped and fell during my 2 visits to the parking area. That is serious and needs to be quickly looked into and improved.
Great brands, great food, great atmosphere, you say it, it‚Äôs great! Highly recommend to visit if you are around Combo, it‚Äôs a big shopping mall with branded stores.

Experience a world class shopping experience. Loads of shops with different varieties of goods. Some stalls were so unique, not seen in other countries' malls even. Apart from all things are so expensive to buy. Good for window shopping.

Its massive and so many things to do. A food court, restaurants in every floor, kids play area, games for teens, branded shops to affordable shops. Brilliant cinema experience while food we ordered being served to the seat. Many places to sit and absolutely stunning sea view. Different interior in different locations. Take a tuk. Especially towards the evening and during the school holidays .Huge queue for the car park due to the security check. have to pay parking fee via credit card through the machine in each floor. Most happening place in the town!!

The mall is outstanding but the wash rooms condition is horrible. When my wife went to use ladies wash room babies were bathing there. And also in gents wash room people were washing feet. The HK team was working hard to keep the place clean all the time specially Prasad i hope he is the HK supervisor. Management team should take proper actions on this to prevent misuse of wash rooms.

It opens at 10 a.m. There are nine movie theaters in the highest floor. So several movies are screening at the same time We had lunch from the Pastamania and there is also a marvelous food court. We spent there about four hours. There's a wide variety of shopping items. Many shops like Nike, CoolPlanet and Odel. As we went on a weekday it was not much crowded.

A nice addition to Galle face - classy mall plenty of choice for shopping & food a bit expensive but suspect mainly aimed at tourists and expats. a nice day out opposite to Galle face green and ocean front.

You can enjoy hours here when you miss modern life after spending days in the beautifully-simple cities of Sri Lanka. Clean, easy-to-navigate, full of shops and restaurants; in this mall you will defenately  find what you have been looking for.

Great new addition to Colombo‚Äôs venues. Its clean and luxurious and hope it would be maintained this way. A lot of interesting shops and a fantastic food court. One thing that would be a real hit will be Hard Rock cafe and cant wait for that to open. An area where there should a big improvement is the arcade, its very old and outdated most of the machines don‚Äôt work and they are very very old, and the worst part is the entire game interface is in Chinese so you don‚Äôt understand what you are supposed to do. The mall for now I would say is less kid friendly in terms of entertainment. But hopefully as things are falling into place it would be improved. The Dilmah tea lounge is amazing as usual, a place that rarely disappoints adds up to a place that will settle you down after an exhausting shopping day.

What a big mall, it did took a half day for exploring the place, many options around you. Things are too expensive but if you can afford, it's worth. Only disappointment is my two years kid did not have much option on games. We had a good time!
Its the latest and greatest multi story multi branded shopping mall in town with ample parking, all brands, restaurants and a good high end food court.

Since we visited Colombo on Poya day (we did not know about this national holiday in advance), everything was closed down. So the only options we had was to checkout the malls and spend time at the Galle face green. This mall is right in front of the beach and it has been recently opened (8th November, 2019). It gives you kind of a luxury feel. I have seen multiple such malls around the world but have to admit that it was the first one in Sri Lanka where I could say the word "luxury". The lower ground floor has a lot of restaurants and a Kells store where you can buy the daily needs stuff at good price. We bought tea and chocolates from here. The restaurants are pretty good too. Although we only tried Pizza hut here. The mall is biggest in Colombo and have a lot of international brands for shopping. The USP of the mall is its location though.

Today visited with my family around 10.30 am its was not crowded. The first luxury mall in Srilanka . Only few branded shop only . The parking is superb and you should make a note of your parking slot no and the location its will be easy to locate when you come back.

Wow another excellent shopping complex to Colombo after CCC.full of international and local uptown branded showrooms and plenty of food outlets.nice to hang around and relax with kids and family,just one big concern is the traffic jam to get it...need to sort out the time taken for the security check up (of course security is must) .all others are ok.

10/10 Amazing mall! First proper mall in Sri Lanka and it was massive! I had a great time in their luxury cinema PVR where they serve you meals as you watch the movie and where the seats are so comfy you can fall asleep. There was so much to do in the mall: from the arcade with VR and a bunch of games, the playzone area for little kids and even an area where children can drive small toy cars. They had a huge variety of food at the food court in the basement and at the restaurants on the 6th floor (even the theatre had tasty food). The mall had so many different shops from luxury watch stores like Rolex and luxury shoe stores like Aldo, to stores affordable by everyone such as Glitz (and even a salon ü§Ø) On the otherhand, my only feedback that I can give is to add more ATM machines. There was only 1 ATM machine located on the 5th floor and it didn't even work. This was weird for such a huge mall as it made it hard to withdraw cash to actually buy stuff from the mass number of stores. If they fix that problem and add more ATMs I have nothing else I want before being able to say it's a perfect mall. It was even more amazing considering they just opened and how Colombo City Center was so empty once it was opened. Overall fantastic experience and would recommend.

Latest shopping mall to open in Sri Lanka and I believe this is the biggest thus far. All types of shops are here and some are still unoccupied. A good area is available in the first floor. In the uppermost floor there‚Äôs a view point from which you can have a good glimpse of the port city, galle face green, galle road . A large parking lot is available here. To enter the parking you need to come from the back side(from Beira lake side). They‚Äôll guide you properly to reach there. It‚Äôs in par with the large shopping malls you find in rich countries.

One Galle face the latest shopping mall in the city of colombo .This mall brings to you the international flavour of shopping experience for all ages in Colombo. Although late but finally now there is a mall that caters to all  .There are foodcourts a movie's theatre the best of srilankan brands for djopping and the renowned international brand all under one roof .. There is great chinese and fish and chips testaurant on the 6th floor with great open terrace offering amazing view of the sea . Still some shops are to open but the best place to shop and eat in Colombo.. Presently heavy rush to checkout the place as it opened on 8th nov specially on weekends..
Definitely Worth A Visit! Awesome variety of shops and dine-in restaurants as well as cafes and many other service's.

This super cool Mall has just recently opened near the Galle Face Green. It houses almost every international brand. We were quite impressed by the interiors and ambiance. In the ground floor was an elaborate food court with every cuisine possible. It also has a few cafes,restaurants. Nice place to spend an evening.

8 November 2019 saw the opening by President Sirisena, of No 1 Galle Face Mall, a 7 storey shopping extravaganza, overlooking Galle Face Green and the Indian Ocean. It is over hyped in the advertising blurb as ‚Äòan integrated lifestyle destination for different communities; this iconic oceanfront is an intimately woven tapestry of the best international brands.‚Äô But there is more to this Shangri La development, than just the Shopping Mall. It is bounded on the north by the Shangri La Hotel and 2 residential blocks on the south side. But it is the shopping mall that most people will experience and very impressive it is too. Spacious, bright, cool and clean. Most of the exclusive retail outlets are here, together with a huge variety of temping restaurants and food outlets. We found it difficult to find our way around. There appeared to be no guides or maps to help us and we had to ask where specific stores were. Although the directory gives the address of each store, it is not shown over the entrance doors. If it was, it would help to find other stores. There were surprisingly few people in the evening, at a time when it should be crowded, when we were there. But perhaps most people have yet to discover No 1 Galle Face, the newest Mall in town.

It's a mall with many outlets such as miniso,kfc,McDonald's,burger king,frosty rolls, Wofl, Kells,Singer,Odel,Jezza,Live and kicking and more.. We had food from the Thalapathkatti outlet at the food studio.. there are variety of biriyani types. IRS very tasty..Also the naan rotti from The mango tree tastes good..  Really worth for the money you are spending.
One Galle Face by Shangri la is the largest shopping complex in Colombo, It‚Äôs rich in numerous branded showrooms , restaurants, kids areas and of course a high star cinema complex.
